questions.text: A 42-year-old man is admitted to the hospital after sustaining fractures of his right femur and tibia in a motor vehicle collision. The patient becomes agitated, hypervigilant, and paranoid 12 hours after admission. He repeatedly tells the nurses that he can hear people in the corridor making insulting remarks about him. When hospital staff check the area near the patient's room, no one is found. Medical history is unremarkable, but psychiatric history is significant for cocaine, marijuana, and alcohol misuse. On examination, the patient is alert and oriented. Temperature is 37.2 C (99 F), blood pressure is 135/87 mm Hg pulse is 85/min, and respirations are 18/min. He is slightly tremulous and diaphoretic. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

Identify the correct statements with respect to the deficits in different brain regions: Lateral geniculate body-Keyhole shaped defect Substantia nigra-Paralysis agitans Putamen-Athetosis Hypothalamus-Hemiballismus

64-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to 2 days of fever, chills, productive cough. The patient has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Oxygen saturation is 94% on room air when lying on his right side but drops to 89% when he lies on his left. Dullness to percussion and bronchial breath sounds are present on the left side. Imaging is shown here. Which of the following pathophysiologic mechanisms in the left lung is most responsible for the drop in oxygen saturation after the change in position?
What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium shown in the figure below?

A 54-year-old woman comes to the clinic due to difficulty hearing for the past few weeks. During the neurologic examination, the physician assesses her hearing using a vibrating tuning fork. The handle of the tuning fork is placed on her left mastoid process until the sound is no longer audible. The tines are then quickly placed near the patient's left auditory meatus, and she reports hearing no sound. When the handle of the vibrating fork is placed on the middle of her forehead, she hears the vibration more strongly in her left ear than her right. This patient is most likely experiencing which of the following types of hearing loss?
questions.correct_answer: A. Conductive loss in left ear
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Conductive loss in left ear

questions.text: Which of the following method of disinfection and sterilization can also kill spores? Glutaraldehyde Ethylene oxide Pasteurization Orthophthalaldehyde

A 41-year-old woman is being evaluated for peripheral edema. The patient has gained 6.8 kg over the past 8 weeks. Her urine is "frothy." Blood pressure is 140/90 mm Hg and pulse is 80/min. Examination shows generalized edema. Heart sounds are normal. The abdomen is soft and nontender. Serum creatinine is 1.1 mg/dL. Urinalysis shows 4+ protein, 0-3 leukocytes/hpf, and oval fat bodies. Serum contains IgG4 antibodies to the phospholipase A2 receptor (PLA2R). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to their primary care physician with a complaint of dysphagia. He reports that he experiences a sensation of food getting stuck in his throat when he eats. He also reports some mild chest discomfort with exertion. The patient has a history of Down syndrome and congenital heart disease. Which imaging modality is typically used to diagnose dysphagia lusoria?

A 10-year-old boy came with complaints of anaemia, weakness, with low weight to height ratio for his age profile. On examination, urine sample shows elevated level of orotic acid. Further study reveals low uridine monophosphate (UMP) synthase activity. What can be the best treatment to administer?

A patient presented with fever, dyspnea, palpitations, and tachycardia. The echocardiography revealed vegetation in the septal leaflets. Tissue sections from them reveal the following findings as shown in the image. What is the most likely implicated agent?

options.label: A
options.text: Pigmented septate hyphae at 90 degrees, Mucormycosis

options.label: B
options.text: Right angle branching septate hyphae, Fusarium

options.label: D
options.text: Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.correct_answer: D. Acute angle branching septate hyphae, Aspergillus

questions.text: Identify the Diagram shown in the image below?

Identify the correct statement Type I collagen is seen in bone and elastic cartilage Reticular fibres are present in lymph nodes, bone marrow and thymus Right-left movement is by atlanto-axial joint Costo-transverse joints are plane synovial joints

A 4-year-old girl is brought to the clinic due to an inward deviated right eye. Examination shows a pale red reflex in the right eye relative to the left eye. Dilated funduscopic examination reveals a well-circumscribed white mass within the retina. Genetic analysis shows a germline mutation in the patient's cells leading to development of the mass. Which of the following is the most likely function of the protein affected by this patient's gene mutation?

options.label: D
options.text: Prevention of the G1/S cell cycle transition

questions.correct_answer: D. Prevention of the G1/S cell cycle transition
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Prevention of the G1/S cell cycle transition

questions.text: All of the following muscles have parallel oriented fibers except:

A 35-year-old, previously healthy man is evaluated immediately after accidental exposure to ionizing radiation at a fluoroscopy manufacturing facility. The patient is currently asymptomatic. Vital signs are normal. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. If radiation exposure is significant, which of the following cells are most likely to be affected first?

A 5-month-old girl was brought to the casualty with seizures. The paediatrician tries to do CSF sampling. What are the structures punctured by the paediatrician while piercing through anterior fontanelle?
Identify the condition showing the following variation in plasma proteins:

A 50-year-old man is scheduled to undergo a colonoscopy for routine colorectal cancer screening. He has no abdominal pain, gross blood in the stool, constipation, change in stool caliber, or unintentional weight loss. He also has no family history of colon cancer. The procedure is uncomplicated, but the patient is found to have a small mucosal lesion (~1 cm) in his sigmoid colon. The lesion is biopsied and its histology is shown in the image below. The pathogenesis of this patient's lesion most likely began with a mutation involving which of the following genes?
Which of the following is NOT one of the three clinical diagnostic criteria for bacterial vaginosis described by Amsel?

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

options.label: C
options.text: Clue cells seen on vaginal saline preparation by light microscopy

options.label: D
options.text: Characteristic fishy odour release with addition of potassium hydroxide to vaginal secretions

questions.correct_answer: B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Presence of an abnormal discharge and erythema of the vagina

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair:

Match the following: Main elevator of mandible Superior head originates from infratemporal surface and infratemporal crest of the greater wing Receives supply from main trunk of trigeminal nerve Originates from zygomatic arch and inserts on the angle of mandible

Identify the true statements: IVC passes through the central tendon of diaphragm Left superior intercostal vein drains into the azygos vein There are two dorsal interossei at the middle finger Superior relation of epiploic foramina is formed by the hepatoduodenal ligament and right adrenal

Identify the false statements: Rickettsial morula in a monocyte is diagnostic of Ehrlichia chaffeensis E6, E7 are targets of vaccine against HPV SARS CO-2 specimen handling for molecular testing needs BSL-2 Peptostreptococcus causes scromboid fish poisoning
Identify the distribution represented by ‘diagram 3’ in the Image below?
Match the following with the appropriate diagnosis: Lichen planus Anti-synthetase syndrome Osteoarthritis Dermatomyositis

Mr. Ramesh, a 55-year-old male patient, has been diagnosed with laryngeal malignancy and is scheduled to undergo modified radical neck dissection (MRND). The surgery is being performed in a sitting position to provide the surgeon with better access to the operative field. The anaesthetic team has taken all necessary precautions to prevent any complications during the surgery. During the surgery, while ligating the internal jugular vein, the patient's end-tidal carbon dioxide (etCO2) dropped from 40 mmHg to 14 mmHg. The patient suddenly developed hypotension along with cardiac arrhythmia, and the surgical team immediately recognized the emergency situation. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 66-year-old woman with warfarin induced bleeding receives IV vitamin K, 4 U PRBCs and 4U FFP. 4h later, she begins to complain of shortness of breath. Vitals T - 39°C, RR 35/min, SpO2 84% on RA, and BP 88/52 mm Hg. Exam revealed B/L crackles and the patient was intubated for respiratory failure. CXR is as shown in the picture. What is the likely diagnosis?

You are preparing to intubate a patient in the operating room. As part of your preoperative assessment, you perform a Mallampati examination to assess the patient's airway. Identify the class from the image shown below?
Correct about Brown-Sequard syndrome:

options.label: A
options.text: Extensive loss of pain on same side below the level of hemisection

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of fine touch and vibration on opposite side below the level of lesion

options.label: C
options.text: Extensive paralysis of muscle on opposite side below the level of lesion

options.label: D
options.text: Complete LMN type paralysis on same side at the level of lesion

questions.correct_answer: D. Complete LMN type paralysis on same side at the level of lesion
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Complete LMN type paralysis on same side at the level of lesion

questions.text: A 2-year-child presented with complaints of abdominal pain following which he develops altered sensorium. He lives in an old house with paint chipping off. The following appearance is noted on X-rays. Which enzyme deficiency is likely in this child causing all these symptoms?

A 45-year-old male with a history of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) presents to the clinic with complaints of fatigue, weakness, and shortness of breath. The patient reports taking his anti-HIV medications consistently, which includes zidovudine (AZT). A complete blood count reveals a hemoglobin level of 8.5 g/dL, and a peripheral blood smear shows macrocytic anemia with erythroblastosis. Which of the following adverse effects of zidovudine is most likely causing the patient's symptoms?

A 24 year old G2 at 28 weeks is brought to the emergency after being found unconscious at home by her mother. She is disoriented on arrival and her BP is 180/110 mmHg and 4 + proteinuria. On arrival at the emergency, she has a tonic-clonic seizure which resolves with MgSO4 administration. Once the patient is stabilized, she undergoes cesarean delivery for fetal distress. Post-partum, the below MRI is done. What is the most likely finding on imaging?

A 63-year woman old presents to the AIIMS emergency chest pain after an RTA. Which resulted in crushed left lower limb. ECG shows 1-2 mm ST elevations in leads V2-V4 & troponin are elevated. The patient undergoes CAG which was normal. Which of the following is likely?

options.label: C
options.text: Severe mitral regurgitation with papillary muscle dysfunction

questions.correct_answer: D. Akinetic LV apex with ballooning
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Akinetic LV apex with ballooning

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman has noted painless enlargement of her neck for the past month. On physical examination, she has diffuse, symmetrical thyroid enlargement without tenderness on palpation. Laboratory studies show her serum TSH is elevated but serum thyroxine is lower side of normal limits. Her microscopic examination is shown here. Which of the following laboratory test findings is she most likely to have?
questions.correct_answer: B. High anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody titre
questions.explanation: Ans. B. High anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody titre

questions.text: All are true about the part labelled here except:

options.label: A
options.text: Derived from a type of atavistic epiphyses

options.label: B
options.text: Gives insertion to pectoralis major muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Short head of biceps takes origin from here

options.label: D
options.text: Can be felt in the infraclavicular fossa on examination

questions.correct_answer: B. Gives insertion to pectoralis major muscle
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Gives insertion to pectoralis major muscle

questions.text: A 7-year-old girl is brought to the office due to a diffuse rash. The father says she developed a lace-like, erythematous rash this morning on her stomach, back, and extremities. Two days ago, the girl developed red, flushed cheeks. She also had congestion, headache, and a low-grade fever for 3 days earlier this week. The infectious agent most likely responsible for this patient's disease replicates in progenitors of which of the following cell lines?
Anaerobic glycolysis of which of these produces 3 ATPs perunit glucose consumed?

Identify the correct pair: Benefit measured in terms of natural units-Cost benefit analysis Method based on behavioral sciences-MBO PERT-Network Analysis Benefit measured in terms of QALY-Cost effective analysis

A newborn is being evaluated in the nursery. The patient was delivered to a 23-year-old woman. The mother developed dark terminal facial hair and a deepened voice during the pregnancy. The delivery was unremarkable, and the patient's vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows ambiguous genitalia land clitoromegaly. Laboratory studies reveal elevated serum levels of testosterone and androstenedione. Karyotype testing shows a 46,XX genotype. Ultrasound of the pelvis shows a normal-sized uterus. This infant's presentation is most likely due to deficiency of which of the following enzymes?
All of the following structures lie in the relation to the left ureter except:

65-year-old man presents with progressive dyspnoea & pulmonary function testing was done. FEV1 is 2.5 L (78% predicted), FVC is 4.00 L (94% predicted), and the FEV1/FVC ratio is 62.5%. The flow-volume curve is shown. What is the most likely cause?

Identify the correct kit for the clinical presentations: Painful ulcers upon palpation, with suppurative inguinal lymphadenopathy on the right side Vaginal discharge in a CSW with cervical erosions Painful, swollen, and tender inguinal lymph node in a truck driver Painless ulcer in the genital area with non-tender inguinal lymphadenopathy in CSW; past h/o treatment of a similar lesion resulted in fever, malaise, tachycardia and vomiting

A 45-year-old male presents with fatigue, night sweats, and weight loss. A complete blood count (CBC) is performed, and the peripheral blood smear shows the presence of cells with increased basophilic cytoplasm, granulocytic precursors, and a high percentage of blasts. A bone marrow biopsy is performed. Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation for this patient's condition?

A 25-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to 2 days of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea. Temperature is 37.1 C (98.8 F), blood pressure is 119/76 mm Hg, pulse is 92/min, and respirations are 16/min. There is abdominal tenderness with no rebound or guarding. Guaiac-positive bloody stools are detected on rectal examination. Stool cultures reveal an Escherichia coli strain that does not produce glucuronidase and does not ferment sorbitol on sorbitol-containing MacConkey agar. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the toxin specific to these bacteria?

A 30 year old man presented with profuse bleeding from the nose which did not stop on applying local pressure or vasoconstrictors. Anterior nasal packing was done but the bleeding could still not be controlled. It was decided to embolize one of the arteries supplying the vascular plexus responsible for most of the anterior nasal bleeds. Which of the following arteries should never be embolized?

options.label: B
options.text: Septal branch of superior labial artery

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to recurrent right lower extremity swelling, pain, and erythema. The patient's medical history includes type 2 diabetes mellitus and depression. Her medications include metformin, paroxetine, and a multivitamin. The patient is diagnosed with cellulitis, admitted to the hospital, and started on antibiotics. She is continued on her home medications. Three days later, the patient becomes agitated and delirious with severe abdominal cramps and diarrhea. Her temperature is 39.2 C (102.6 F). blood pressure is 180/100 mm Hg, and heart rate is 120/min and regular. On examination, the patient is diaphoretic and tremulous, and her pupils are dilated. Bilateral hyperreflexia and ankle clonus are present. She begins to have seizures. Which of the following antibiotics was the patient most likely given to treat the cellulitis?

Identify the incorrect statements: Superficial anterior compartment of leg has no neurovascular bundle Tectorial membrane is the superior continuation of PLL After parotidectomy, a person complains of loss of sensation in the shaving area. This is likely due to injury to auriculotemporal nerve. Common carotid artery divides at the level of lower border of thyroid cartilage Ansa cervicalis lies on the posterior wall of carotid sheath

A medical student have given a topic to present in class. The topic given to you was excitation-contraction coupling. It is a process in which muscle cells are stimulated to contract and it is followed by muscle cell relaxation. It involves the following events: Action potential Calcium release into the cytoplasm Cross-bridge cycling Cytoplasmic calcium removal Depolarization of T tubules Which of the following options lists the correct sequence of events for excitation-contraction coupling in skeletal muscle tissue?

A female presents to the emergency 2 weeks after a normal vaginal delivery with abnormal involuntary flexure of the neck towards one side. History taking revealed that she was unable to lactate spontaneously for which she took a medication that she found on the internet without taking proper medical advice. Intake of which of the following drugs is most likely to lead to this condition?
A 30-year-old female came to the OPD with complaints of backache. On examination, her eyes and pinna revealed blackish discoloration. What is the likely diagnosis?

Identify the correct statements: KEYNOTE-189 trial investigated NSCLC treatment using this drug that acts via pathway B. Drug acting via pathway B has a role in treatment of ca endometrium. Osimertinib is specifically used for treating NSCLC patients with T790M mutations and acts via pathway A. Ipilimumab is a medication used in the management and treatment of metastatic melanoma that acta via pathway C.
A neonate is lethargic, drowsy, and irritable with blood analysis showing hyperammonemia and orotic aciduria. Considering this patient, orotic acid levels are high due to which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: C. Bypassing carbamoyl phosphate synthetase II (CPS-II)
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Bypassing carbamoyl phosphate synthetase II (CPS-II)

questions.text: The cranial nerve which is a content of the space labelled in the image below passes through which cranial foramina:

46-year-old man is admitted to the hospital for elective cholecystectomy. He is started on intravenous fluids and antibiotics. Just before he is to go to an operating room, the patient complains of a sudden onset of chest tightness and light-headedness. His medical history is significant for anxiety, and he has had 2 previous visits to the emergency department for panic attacks. His blood pressure is 118/67 mm Hg. His electrocardiogram is shown here. Which of the following is the best initial step in treating this patient?

Glycogen synthesis and breakdown takes place in the same cell, having enzymes necessary for both the pathways. Why the glucose-6-phosphate, freshly synthesized during glycogenesis in cytoplasm of hepatocytes, is not immediately degraded by the enzyme glucose-6-phosphatase?

options.label: A
options.text: The thermodynamics does not favor such a reaction to occur

options.label: B
options.text: Glucose-6-phosphatase is present in the endoplasmic reticulum and cannot act on glycogen formed in the cytoplasm

options.label: C
options.text: Glycogenesis and glycogenolysis are tightly regulated such that enzymes of only one of those are present at a time.

questions.correct_answer: B. Glucose-6-phosphatase is present in the endoplasmic reticulum and cannot act on glycogen formed in the cytoplasm
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Glucose-6-phosphatase is present in the endoplasmic reticulum and cannot act on glycogen formed in the  cytoplasm

questions.text: Healthy adult volunteers are enrolled in a phase I clinical trial investigating the properties of a newly developed oral antimicrobial agent. The drug is administered in different amounts to the volunteers over the course of several weeks to determine the best dosage that minimizes toxicity while maintaining trough levels above the minimum inhibitory concentration. While reviewing the data, the researchers note that the drug's half-life seems to vary amongst the study participants. An increase in which of the following pharmacologic parameters is most likely responsible for the longer half-life seen in certain individuals?

A person presents with pneumonia. His sputum was sent for culture. The bacterium obtained showed gram positive cocci in chains on microscopy and alpha haemolytic colonies on sheep agar. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?

Identify the true statements: In amyloidosis, Beta pleated sheet will be seen in X-ray crystallography. There is decrease in thyroid-binding globulin, transferrin, and fibrinogen in nephrotic syndrome. Blood transfusion requires screening of donor blood for HIV, HCV, HBV but not dengue. Massive splenomegaly is noted in hairy cell leukaemia, CML and aplastic anemia.

A 30 year P1 with a last menstrual period 10 days ago presents to the emergency with complaints of worsening right pelvic pain. She says that she had sudden onset of sharp pain after bending over to pick up her child. The pain did not respond to acetaminophen and has intermittently worsened during the past several hours. She also had 2 episodes of vomiting. On examination, there is abdominal guarding. Transvaginal sonography demonstrates an 8-cm enlarged right ovary. There is high impedance arterial flow of the ovary on colour Doppler. These findings are most consistent with which of the following clinical diagnoses?
Which of these represents true gastro-esophageal (GE) junction tumour?

options.label: A
options.text: Located between 5 cm and 1 cm above GE junction

options.label: B
options.text: Located between 2 cm above and 1 cm below GE junction

options.label: C
options.text: Located between 1 cm above and 2 cm below GE junction

options.label: D
options.text: Located between 1 cm above and 1 cm below GE junction

questions.correct_answer: C. Located between 1 cm above and 2 cm below GE junction
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Located between 1 cm above and 2 cm below GE junction

questions.text: 26-year-old woman is being evaluated for a possible inherited disorder. She has a 6-year history of generalized tonic-clonic seizures, and a year ago, she had partial loss of vision due to an occipital infarction. Her mother has chronic intermittent muscle weakness and lactic acidosis, and her maternal uncle has hemiplegia. After further evaluation, all the affected family members are found to suffer from the same inherited disease. Pedigree analysis is shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the variability of clinical manifestations in the affected family members?
Which of the following muscle is supplied by the nucleus present beneath the area marked by the arrow in adjoining image?

56-year-old man is evaluated for dyspnea, wheezing, and cough productive of yellow sputum. The patient reports that he has been treated with antibiotics when the dyspnea is severe. He has smoked 2 packs of cigarettes daily for the past 25 years. The schematic diagram below is a representation of a bronchial wall. Which of the following ratios is the best pathological index to determine the severity of this patient's disease?

63-year-old man is admitted to the hospital after sufering a cerebral infarction. A swallow study performed during the acute recovery period shows oropharyngeal dysphagia. Despite being maintained on the appropriate dietary restrictions, the patient experiences an episode of vomiting while lying on his back and subsequently develops pneumonia. Which of the following lung regions is most likely to be affected?

options.label: A
options.text: Anterior segment of the left upper lobe

options.label: B
options.text: Basilar segments of the right lower lobe

options.label: C
options.text: Lingular segments of the left lung

options.label: D
options.text: Posterior segment of the right upper lobe

questions.correct_answer: D. Posterior segment of the right upper lobe
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Posterior segment of the right upper lobe

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair of contraceptive dosages:

options.label: A
options.text: Ulipristal for emergency contraception-30mg single dose

options.label: B
options.text: LNG for emergency contraception 1.5mg two tablets repeated after 12hrs

questions.correct_answer: B. LNG for emergency contraception 1.5mg two tablets repeated after 12hrs
questions.explanation: Ans. B. LNG for emergency contraception 1.5mg two tablets repeated after 12hrs

questions.text: This is a schematic diagram depicting body structure of which of these helminthes?

31-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her boyfriend due to confusion. The boyfriend says that the patient "seemed okay" when he left for work this morning, but when he returned in the evening, she was disoriented and "acting like a drunk person"; she had also vomited "all over the bathroom." She has a history of bipolar disorder. Medications include clonazepam, lithium, and quetiapine. Temperature is 37 C (98.6 F), blood pressure is 110/68 mm Hg, pulse is 92/min, and respirations are 16/min. On physical examination, the patient is somnolent and has frequent fasciculations. Pupils are equal and reactive. During evaluation, she has a brief episode of a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. Laboratory results are as follows: Hemoglobin: 13 g/dL Leukocytes: 9,000/mm³ Sodium: 136 mEq/L Potassium: 3.8 mEq/L Bicarbonate: 28 mEq/L Creatinine: 1.2 mg/dL Glucose: 120 mg/dL Serum lithium 2.8 mEq/L In addition to supportive measures, which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?
Which of the following is likely with ascitic fluid protein 1.9 g/dL and a serum albumin ascites gradient (SAAG) of 1.4?
In the histology section given, which marked area is involved in relieving pain in response to massage?

A 25-year-old male patient presented with sudden onset breathlessness and a sharp pain in his chest after a road traffic accident. His BP is 85/69mmHg and HR is 110bpm. The chest X-ray is given below. What is the next step for this patient? eFAST Insert iv cannula and start iv fluids Needle thoracostomy ICD insertion Thoracotomy CECT chest

A 14-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department following a suicide attempt. She swallowed several of her grandfather's theophylline tablets after an intense argument with her parents a few hours ago. The patient reports nausea and headache. Her temperature is 37 C (98.6 F), blood pressure is 114/76 mm Hg, pulse is 88/min, and respirations are 16/min. This patient should be carefully monitored for which of the following?

A 47-year-old woman comes to the office due to fever, dysuria, and abdominal pain. The patient has had several urinary tract infections since her teens but has no other medical concerns. Physical examination shows mild suprapubic discomfort. Urinalysis demonstrates pyuria and many bacteria. CT scan of the abdomen is shown in the image below: Which of the following structures has most likely limited the proper ascent of the anomalous organ seen on CT scan?
Which among the following species is transmitted through the vector given in the image?

A 40-year-old male patient is being evaluated for a suspected brain tumor. A biopsy is obtained whose image has been shown below. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis based upon the biopsy findings?

A 13-year-old girl has complaints of recurrent nose bleeds and excessive loss of blood during menstruation. She appears pale. Laboratory studies reveals the following: Hemoglobin - 7 g/dL Platelets - 2 lac/mm3 Bleeding time - Prolonged PT - Normal aPTT - Prolonged Which of the following factors may be deficient in this case?
Identify the scheme which bears the logo given below:
questions.correct_answer: C. Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Labour Room Quality Improvement Initiative

questions.text: Identify the correct pair:
All of the following are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Dermis has dense irregular connective tissue

options.label: B
options.text: Fibrocartilage, bones, tendons have collagen type I

options.label: C
options.text: Hyaline cartilage has perichondrium with 2-4 chondrocytes in each lacuna

options.label: D
options.text: Fibres from Inferior olivary nucleus directly reach the purkinje cells in cerebellum, which constitute the largest neurons in human brain

questions.correct_answer: D. Fibres from Inferior olivary nucleus directly reach the purkinje cells in cerebellum, which constitute the largest neurons in human brain

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Miami criteria: 50% reduction in PTH within 10 mins of gland removal Majority of the retrosternal goitres derive their blood supply from mediastinal vessels Purulent peritonitis following a perforated diverticulitis is Hinchey grade 3 CECT abdomen in stable patients with eFAST positive is a part of “C” of primary survey

A 7-year-old male patient is taken for right side radius-ulna open reduction internal fixation surgery under General anesthesia. As the child seems uncooperative for regional anesthesia, you decide to start general anesthesia induction with an inhalational agent via mask. Within a few minutes the patient starts breath holding and coughing. To find out the cause you check the inhalational agent vaporizer and you immediately turn it off and switch on the non- irritant Inhalational agent. What was the probable Inhalational agent which led to coughing and breath holding

A 52-year-old man has undergone lung transplantation. Two months after receiving lung transplant, he developed pulmonary symptoms and was diagnosed as having bilateral diffuse interstitial pulmonary pneumonitis and bronchiolitis. Which of the following etiological agent is responsible in this condition?

Following road traffic accident patient suffers polytrauma and is evaluated in the emergency section of the hospital. His pulse rate is 116, respiratory rate is 24, blood pressure of 122/78 mm of Hg and patient is mildly anxious. What is the approximate blood loss patient has following trauma?
Calculate the corrected reticulocyte count of a patient with haemoglobin of 5 and absolute reticulocyte count of 9%?

A woman presented to the clinic with heavy, painful menses that have worsened over the past year. On pelvic examination the uterus is enlarged and tender. MRI scan of the patient’s abdomen revealed a finding similar to the image given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 29-year-old female presented with complaints of secondary amenorrhea for the past 6 months. She reports having a regular menstrual cycle in the past and there were no recent changes in weight, exercise, or stress. She does not use any contraceptives and has no significant medical history. On examination, she appears well nourished. Her pregnancy test is negative. What is the next best step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Measurement of serum FSH and LH levels

questions.correct_answer: B. Measurement of serum FSH and LH levels
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Measurement of serum FSH and LH levels

questions.text: A patient with metastatic prostate cancer develops hypocalcemia during treatment with a bone antiresorptive agent. Which of the following agents is most likely to result in hypocalcemia?
This device shown in the image is used in:
questions.correct_answer: A. Men with suspected urethral stricture
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Men with suspected urethral stricture

questions.text: 23-year-old comes to the ED with the feeling of food being stuck in the throat. Laryngoscopy reveals fish bone lodged in the left piriform recess. During retrieval of the fish bone, a nerve deep to the mucosa overlying the recess is damaged. Which of the following is most likely to be impaired in this patient as a result of his iatrogenic injury?
The following hematoxylin and eosin-stained biopsy is from which tissue?

A therapist observes distinct patterns in her sessions with a 35-year-old woman who has a turbulent history with relationships. Initially, the woman sings praises about the therapist, declaring her as the best thing that's happened to her. However, after a few sessions, she arrives agitated, accusing the therapist of not genuinely wanting to help her. These extreme shifts in perception occur frequently, creating a turbulent therapeutic environment. Which defense mechanism is predominantly being exhibited by this patient?

A 73-year-old man comes to the emergency department with unstable angina. He undergoes coronary angiography via the femoral approach. A stent is placed in the right coronary artery, and the patient is discharged. He returns to the emergency department 2 days later with blue discoloration of his right toe. He has pain and mild tingling in the affected toe. On physical examination, the right toe appears cyanotic, and there is livedo reticularis affecting the right thigh. Serum creatinine is 2.8 mg/dL (preoperatively it was 1.0 mg/dL). Which of the following histopathologic findings would most likely be seen on biopsy of this patient's kidney?

options.label: C
options.text: Extensive necrosis of proximal tubular cells

questions.correct_answer: A. Cholesterol clefts in arterial lumen
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Cholesterol clefts in arterial lumen

questions.text: A 60 year old male with history of long standing goitre visits the OPD. Surgeon performs this manoeuver- which makes the patient breathless. This finding implies?

A patient presents to the emergency room with symptoms of fever, increased respiratory rate, elevated heart rate, and low blood pressure. The physician suspects the patient may have SIRS. Which of the following is not a criteria for SIRS?

options.label: B
options.text: Temperature >38 degree Celsius or <36 degree Celsius

questions.text: A 23-year-old man with HL was treated successfully with the ABVD regimen. Which of the following drugs used in the treatment of this patient is cell cycle specific ?

A 60-year-old male is brought to the emergency department by ambulance after a road traffic accident. He doesn't know where he is, he is unable to identify his relatives and is in a state of confusion. On examination, he has eye-opening only on painful stimuli and can localize the site of painful stimuli. What is the GCS score of this patient?
Identify the marked layer:
Identify the incorrect pair:
Match the following images with the correct name of the manouever:
Identify the correct statements: Social smile - 2months Walk without support - 12months Babbling gibberish - 15months Walk upstairs with alternate foot - 4yrs Copy a circle - 2yrs

A 65-year-old male with a history of atrial fibrillation and recent coronary artery bypass graft surgery presents with bleeding from the surgical wound site. Laboratory tests reveal a normal platelet count and coagulation panel. Thromboelastography (TEG) is ordered to assess the patient's clotting profile. Which of the following TEG tracings is most consistent with the patient's presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced R-time, increased angle, increased MA, increased LY30

options.label: B
options.text: Prolonged R-time, decreased angle, decreased MA, decreased LY30

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced R-time, decreased angle, increased MA, decreased LY30

questions.correct_answer: C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

questions.text: A Female had a thorn prick 5 years ago. She presented with a slowly growing 2 × 2 cm verrucous lesion which on KOH mount showed the following image. Identify the condition?

A 13-year-old girl is brought to the office for evaluation of acne. She began to develop acne over her forehead and chin 4 months ago. She used over-the-counter topical salicylic acid, but the acne did not improve. Now, the patient has painful acne over her face and upper chest. She has not had a menstrual period. The girl has grown 10.1 cm in the last year; her height and weight are at the 70th percentile for age. Vital signs are normal. Nodulocystic acne is present across the face and upper chest. There is no breast bud development. The abdomen is nontender and has no palpable masses. External pelvic examination shows the clitoris protruding from the clitoral hood and bilateral masses in the labia majora. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 24-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to weakness, lethargy, nausea, and dizziness. He took fifty 325-mg acetaminophen tablets approximately 6 hours ago. Vital signs are normal. Pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light; there is mild epigastric tenderness. Laboratory results include an elevated serum acetaminophen level. Intravenous infusion of N-acetylcysteine is started. This treatment is most likely to improve the patient's condition by which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: C
options.text: Increasing the amount of intrahepatic glutathione

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing renal excretion of drug molecules

questions.correct_answer: C. Increasing the amount of intrahepatic glutathione
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Increasing the amount of intrahepatic glutathione

questions.text: What does IP in the figure shown stands for?

options.label: A
options.text: Drug is an instant release preparation

options.label: C
options.text: The standards according to Indian Pharmacopoeia

options.label: D
options.text: Drug tested preclinically via Intraperitoneal route

questions.correct_answer: C. The standards according to Indian Pharmacopoeia
questions.explanation: Ans. C. The standards according to Indian

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department for difficulty breathing and a productive cough. He has a past medical history of recurrent episodes of sinusitis and otitis media. The respiratory infections typically have a protracted course but respond to high-dose antibiotic therapy. Pulmonary auscultation shows crackles and wheezing. Cardiovascular examination shows a cardiac point of maximal impulse that is palpated at the right 5 th intercostal space. Which of the following is most likely to be dysfunctional in this patient?

A 23-year-old medical student presents to the surgery emergency department after cutting her wrist with a blade. After receiving first aid, the resident notices multiple healed cut marks on her wrist. Upon psychiatry referral, the patient informs the resident that she cut herself because she was feeling very angry at her boyfriend who spent the entire evening watching an IPL match rather than calling her. She also mentions that she has never been in a relationship with a guy for more than 2 months and believes that all men are horrible, while women are the best. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

65-year-old woman is concerned about her risk of fracture as her mother was hospitalized for osteoporotic hip fracture in the past. She has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, coronary artery disease, seizure disorder, and gastroesophageal reflux disease. The patient underwent menopause at age 52. She has smoked a pack of cigarettes daily for 24 years but does not drink alcohol. Weight is 56 kg. Long-term use of which of the following medications may increase this patient's risk of osteoporosis and hip fracture?

Which of the following is included in high-quality CPR? Compression depth of at least 5 cm Rotate chest compressor every 3 mins Avoid excessive ventilation Compression - ventilation ratio of 30:2 Allow complete recoil ET co2 <10mm Intra-arterial DBP >20mm Hg Breaths 20-30/min

Which of the following statements regarding reducing activation energy are true: ΔGf is lowered Stability of transition state is reduced It depends upon complementarity of active site of enzyme and substrate Conformational change may occur at the active site of enzyme at the time of binding to substrate

A 40-year-old nulligravida woman comes to the office with a 2-month history of worsening right pelvic pain. She experiences the pain daily, and its intensity does not vary during her menstrual cycle. In addition, the patient's waist size has increased despite a decreased appetite. Pelvic examination shows an irregularly shaped, fixed adnexal mass. One week later, she undergoes surgery to remove a large ovarian neoplasm. Within the true pelvis, the surgeon can most likely palpate the right ureter immediately anterior to which of the following structures?

A 35-year-old male, diagnosed with squint presented to the ophthalmology department for regular check-up. On examination, marked muscle was found affected. At which level does the nerve supply for the marked structure arise?

15-year-old boy comes to the OPD due to right ear itching and discomfort for the past several days. He has no fever or hearing loss but has noted scant drainage of thin, whitish fluid. The patient has been taking swimming lessons at a local gym. On examination, there is no redness around the ear, but gentle traction of the pinna elicits pain. During inspection of the external auditory canal, a speculum is inserted into the meatus in close contact with its posterior wall, causing the patient to suddenly become lightheaded and faint. He recovers spontaneously within a few minutes with no residual confusion. Which of the following nerves was most likely irritated during the procedure?

A 45-year-old woman is brought to the hospital after she collapsed during an airshow on a hot summer day. She is receiving amitriptyline for fibromyalgia. Temperature is 40.5 ° C (104.9 ° F), blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg, pulse is 110/min, and respirations are 22/min. The skin is warm and red. She is disoriented. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. If this patient's medication contributed to her current condition, which of the following mechanisms is most likely responsible?

options.label: A
options.text: Impaired cardiovascular response to heat stress

options.label: C
options.text: Increased heat production by increasing muscle tone

questions.correct_answer: B. Impaired dissipation of body heat
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Impaired dissipation of body heat

questions.text: Identify the false statement from the following:

options.label: A
options.text: True positive fistula test indicates perilymph fistula

options.label: B
options.text: False positive fistula test indicates congenital syphilis

options.label: C
options.text: True negative fistula test indicates late stages of Meniere’s disease

options.label: D
options.text: False negative fistula test indicates dead labyrinth

questions.correct_answer: C. True negative fistula test indicates late stages of Meniere’s disease
questions.explanation: Ans. C. True negative fistula test indicates late stages of Meniere’s disease

questions.text: Identify the true statements: 1. At physiological pH, arginine has a positive charge 2. Selenocysteine is coded by UGA 3. Heme synthesis occurs in BM, RBCS and hepatocytes 4. Vitamin C cannot be produced in humans due to lack of L-gulonolactone oxidase

A 25-year-old homeless man with a history of schizophrenia is brought to the hospital by local police. He destroyed a television set at a local electronics store and then became extremely agitated and violent when employees attempted to intervene The patient's speech is difficult to follow, and he is distracted, seemingly listening to voices that only he can hear. He is admitted to the psychiatric ward and given haloperidol, which calms him down. Later that evening, however, he walks to the nurses' station and says, "What's happening to me?" The patient is upset and refuses to sit down, pointing to his neck. Physical examination shows a sustained contraction of his neck to the right side. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

Match the following: Stimulation of this area results in turning the eyes and head to the contralateral side A lesion here results in nonfluent, telegraphic speech Ablation in this area results in a contralateral upper homonymous quadrantanopia A lesion here results in fluent speech with neologisms A lesion of this area is characterized by finger agnosia, dyscalculia, dysgraphia, and dyslexia Destruction of this area results in an aphasia characterized by fluent speech, good comprehension, and poor repetition Lesions in this gyrus result in contralateral astereognosis Lesions in this gyrus result in contralateral spasticity

A research group conducted a study to compare the levels of creatine kinase-MB (CK-MB) between type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) patients given statin therapy. Participants were divided into 4 groups based on treatment. Groups I, II, and III consisted of T2DM patients who had been given statin therapy (atorvastatin, simvastatin, rosuvastatin, respectively) for at least 6 months. Group IV consisted of T2DM patients who had not been given statin therapy. Which of the following statistical tests is most appropriate to compare the CK-MB levels between Groups I, II, III, and IV in this study?
Identify the incorrect pair: Talocalcaneonavicular joint - Saddle joint Malleo-incudal joint - Ball and socket joint Atlanto-axial joint - Pivot joint Acromio-clavicular joint - Plane joint
Identify the organism from the life cycle

A 24-year-old male is brought to the psychiatry emergency department by his family members. They report that he has been muttering to himself, exhibiting suspicious behaviour, and believing that neighbours are conspiring against him by video recording him. He has not attended work for the last three months. Over the past month, he has become more withdrawn, speaking minimally, and has been observed standing in his room at the same place for hours. In the last two days, the patient has stopped speaking completely and has refused food and water. In the emergency department, the patient did not respond to any questions and stood as given in the image below for 30 minutes. What is the best next step in the management of this patient?

35-year-old man with a history of bipolar and substance use disorders comes to the emergency department due to depression, auditory hallucinations, and suicidal ideation. His medications include lithium and escitalopram. The patient has a history of 5 psychiatric hospitalizations and 2 past suicide attempts, including overdose on his medications and attempted hanging. The patient has been using "anything I can get my hands on" because his depression is unbearable. He is hospitalized and placed on suicide precautions. His dose of escitalopram is increased to target his depression, and risperidone is added to treat the hallucinations. His lithium level is 1.0 mEq/L. On the second day of hospitalization, the patient reports muscle pains, abdominal cramping, nausea, and diarrhea. His temperature is 37.2 C (99 F), blood pressure is 130/85 mm Hg, and pulse is 84/min. The patient is alert and restless, and his pupils are dilated bilaterally. Bowel sounds are hyperactive and neurologic examination is normal. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for his symptoms?

A 45-year-old previously healthy man comes to the office for evaluation of a neck lump. The patient first noticed the swelling a month ago while shaving, and it has progressively enlarged. On physical examination, there is a nontender, firm nodule in the upper portion of the left thyroid lobe. Laboratory studies reveal a normal serum TSH and elevated serum calcitonin levels. Neck ultrasonography shows a 2-cm hypoechoic thyroid nodule with microcalcifications. Fine-needle aspiration of the nodule reveals spindle-shaped cells in an amorphous background. Which of the following gene alterations most likely contributed to this patient's current condition?
If changes made in some of the sequence of amino acids in the chain of human proinsulin, which of the following changes will not make any difference in the biochemical activity of the molecule?
questions.correct_answer: C. Interchange of B29 and B30
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Interchange of B29 and B30

questions.text: Which procedure is shown in the following picture?
The nerve being tested here is injured most likely at what site?

options.label: A
options.text: Between two heads of pronator teres

options.label: B
options.text: At the level of supinator muscle

questions.text: In which of the given cases is this procedure usually performed?
questions.correct_answer: C. BCT in node negative patients
questions.explanation: Ans. C. BCT in node negative patients

questions.text: Which of the following is not a correct match with respect to the mechanism of action and clinical use of the given drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: Zavegepant - CGRP receptor antagonist used for the treatment of acute migraine attacks

options.label: B
options.text: Sparsentan - Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

options.label: C
options.text: Lenacapavir - HIV-1 capsid inhibitor used for the treatment of HIV infection

options.label: D
options.text: Teplizumab - Anti-CD3 monoclonal antibody used for the prevention of type 1 diabetes in high-risk individuals

questions.correct_answer: B. Sparsentan - Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Sparsentan - Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

questions.text: All are true about the muscle whose function is tested in the below shown test except:

options.label: A
options.text: Inserts into the lesser tubercle of the humerus

options.label: D
options.text: Supplied by a branch of the posterior cord of the brachial plexus

questions.correct_answer: B. Primary function is external rotation

questions.text: You are the team leader during a cardiac arrest resuscitation scenario in a hospital setting. A 65-year-old patient has suddenly collapsed and is unresponsive. The monitor displays a rhythm as shown in the image. What is the next immediate step?
A screening test is positive in 50% diseased population and 10% healthy population. Calculate the PPV:

6-year-old girl is brought to the office for evaluation of short stature. Her parents have noticed that she bears little resemblance to her 2 older siblings. The patient's mother and father are 172.5 cm (5'8") and 183 cm (6') tall, respectively. On physical examination, the patient's height is 3 standard deviations below the mean for her age. Other findings include low-set ears, a high arched palate a webbed neck, and cubitus valgus. Chromosomal analysis reveals a 45,XO karyotype. The patient is started on a medication to improve growth and normalize her height. Which of the following intracellular pathways is stimulated by the medication used in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Binding of activated receptors to DNA to modify transcription

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Grade 2 disability per 10 lac population is the most important leprosy awareness indicator VVM shows cumulative exposure of the vaccine to the heat and assess vaccine potency As per the National Tuberculosis Elimination Program (NTEP), HIV-TB prevalence of district >15% is a high-priority district The external validity of a screening test is related to generalizability

44-year-old man comes to the OPD for follow-up of type 2 diabetes mellitus. He was diagnosed with diabetes 4 years ago and has been taking metformin since then. Six months ago, a new antidiabetic agent was added due to suboptimal glycemic control. Today, the patient is happy because he has lost 7 kg without any changes in diet or activity since the new therapy was started. His only symptoms are occasional nausea vomiting, and a prolonged sensation of fullness after eating. Laboratory testing reveals normal renal function studies and hemoglobin A1c of 7.2%. If this patient's weight loss is due to the new medication, which of the following agents is most likely responsible?

A 20-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by police at 2:30 AM after she was caught attempting to scale a fence at the Rashtrapati Bhawan. The patient appears highly agitated and paces around the examination room. She has just flown in from out of state to "meet with the president about a foolproof plan for eliminating worldwide terrorism." The patient has barely slept for the past week due to her intensive work on this plan. The evaluation has to be stopped when the patient begins banging on the door and demanding to leave. Temperature is 37 C (98.6 F), blood pressure is 148/84 mm Hg, pulse is 98/min, and respirations are 22/min. Urine drug screen is negative. Administration of which of the following medications is the most appropriate next step in management of this patient?

A 19-year-old man comes to the physician due to diarrhea for the last 4 months. He visited a student health clinic at his university a month ago and was prescribed a course of antibiotics, but his diarrhea failed to improve. He also has persistent nausea, a bloating sensation, and a 6.8-kg weight loss. Microscopic examination of his stool is shown in the image. Impairment of which of the following immune functions would most likely predispose to this patient's infection?

A 4-month-old girl is diagnosed with a febrile urinary tract infection. A voiding cystourethrogram is shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this infant's presentation?

options.label: C
options.text: Obstruction due to a renal stone

options.label: D
options.text: Presence of a posterior urethral valve

questions.correct_answer: A. Congenital short intravesical ureter length
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Congenital short intravesical ureter length

questions.text: A 24y P2L2 who does not want more children presents to the OPD as she cannot feel the thread of the Multiload 375 that was inserted 3 years earlier. Her last menstrual period was 3 weeks earlier. On examination, the cervix appears normal, and the thread is not seen. A transvaginal scan shows the following image. What is the next best step?

options.label: C
options.text: Remove the IUCD with a hook

questions.text: 37-year-old woman, gravida 2 para 1, at 30 weeks gestation comes to the OPD for a routine prenatal examination. Her pregnancy has been uncomplicated to date, and fetal movement is present. At the last visit, she drank a solution containing 50 g of glucose, and serum glucose was abnormally elevated an hour later. Which of the following hormones is most likely contributing to o this patient's abnormal laboratory findings?

31-year-old woman comes to the office due to transient visual changes that are characterized by "loss of vision for a minute" and commonly precipitated by bending forward or lifting objects. During the last 3 months, she has had persistent headaches that she attributes to migraines. The patient takes over-the-counter analgesics as needed. Blood pressure is 140/90 mm Hg and pulse is 72/min and regular. BMI is 32.4 kg/m2. Funduscopic findings of the left eye are shown in the image below, with similar findings in the right eye. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the observed funduscopic findings in this patient?

Identify the true statements: TxA2 has platelet aggregating and vasoconstricting effect Lipoxin B4 inhibits inhibit neutrophil chemotaxis and adhesion to endothelium. II-1, II-18, TNF are pyrogenic cytokines C3 can be activated is both common as well as alternative pathways T cells with a TCR composed of a γ and δ subunit are found associated with GI mucosa
Identify the nerve block given at the point shown:

7-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for a routine health maintenance examination. He underwent a splenectomy a year ago for persistent anemia and jaundice. He has received the pneumococcal and meningococcal vaccinations and takes penicillin prophylaxis. Physical examination reveals a well-appearing child. The sclerae are anicteric. The abdomen is soft and nontender; no masses are palpable. Several well-healed laparoscopy scars are noted. Complete blood count is as follows: Hemoglobin: 11.3 g/dL Reticulocytes: 3% Platelets: 160,000/mm³ Leukocytes: 8,200/mm³ Peripheral blood smear with Wright stain is shown. This patient's findings are most likely related to which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Inability to produce beta globin chains

options.label: D
options.text: Persistence of red blood cell precursor nuclei

questions.correct_answer: D. Persistence of red blood cell precursor nuclei
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Persistence of red blood cell precursor nuclei

questions.text: Which of these is an example of anaplerotic reaction?
Match the following drugs with their specific side effects:

A 70-year-old man, a retired banking executive with a history of smoking is admitted in ward with shortness of breath. Interpret the acid base disorder based on the arterial blood gas analysis report mentioned below. pH – 7.30, PCO2 -65 mm Hg, PO2 -60 mmHg, HCO3 - 36 mEq/L.

All of the following are true: Leptin acts via JAK-STAT signalling pathway Damage to the Zona Occludens can result in increased permeability in Vibrio cholera diarrhea Raised 2,3 BPG, Acidosis, HbF cause a right shift of the oxygen-hemoglobin dissociation curve Macula densa is located at the Junction of thick ascending limb and DCT The organ with the least arteriovenous pressure difference is the kidney.

A 15-year-old male presents to emergency department in a comatose state. He was found in this state by his friend in the schoolyard. His friend confesses that the patient has been depressed over the past several days. His initial labs reveal hypocalcaemia and a severe metabolic acidosis. The urine shows calcium oxalate crystals. What was the toxin ingested?

A 64-year-old man is evaluated for persistent fever and weakness. He has a history of aortic valve replacement for aortic stenosis. Physical examination reveals a new cardiac murmur with scattered petechia and splinter hemorrhages seen on his extremities. Echocardiogram shows a vegetation involving one of the aortic valve leaflets, and blood cultures grow enterococci. As part of the patient's treatment, 240 mg of intravenous gentamicin is started. The pharmacy calculates that, in this patient, gentamicin has a volume of distribution of 30L, a half-life of 4 hours, and demonstrates first-order kinetics. Which of the following is the most likely serum drug concentration just before the next dose 8 hours later?

Which of the following statements is/are true regarding anti-tubercular drugs? Isoniazid inhibits mycolic acid synthesis in the cell wall of Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Rifampicin is primarily used for the treatment of active tuberculosis and can cause liver toxicity and flu-like symptoms. Bedaquiline is a second-line anti-tubercular drug that can cause QT prolongation and requires cardiac monitoring. Pretomanid is primarily used as a monotherapy for the treatment of tuberculosis.

A patient has the following laboratory findings: Sodium – 138 mEq/L Potassium – 4.4 mEq/L Chloride – 112 mEq/L Bicarbonate – 8.0 mEq/L Arterial pH – 7.21 Which of the following is the most likely acid-base status?

options.label: B
options.text: Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus metabolic alkalosis

options.label: C
options.text: Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus normal anion gap metabolic acidosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus normal anion gap metabolic acidosis
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Anion gap metabolic acidosis plus normal anion gap metabolic acidosis

questions.text: A 30y P1 with a last menstrual period 10 days ago presents to the emergency with complaints of worsening right pelvic pain. She says that she had sudden onset of sharp pain after bending over to pick up her child. The pain did not respond to acetaminophen and has intermittently worsened during the past several hours. She also had 2 episodes of vomiting. On examination, there is abdominal guarding. Transvaginal sonography demonstrates an 8-cm enlarged right ovary. There is high impedance arterial flow of the ovary on colour Doppler. These findings are most consistent with which of the following clinical diagnoses?

46-year-old man comes to the OPD due to right shoulder pain. The pain started 2 months ago after the patient began working at a new warehouse where he frequently moves heavy boxes. On physical examination, external rotation of the right shoulder against resistance is painful, but there is no weakness. MRI reveals near complete tear of the right infraspinatus muscle. The absence of weakness in this patient is best explained by compensatory hypertrophy of which of the following muscles?
Match the following with the mode of cellular transport:
Which of the following genetic defect regarding Maturity Onset Diabetes in the Young (MODY) is incorrectly matched?

Which of the following statements is true about beta blockers: Carvedilol is the most widely used beta blocker. These are drug of choice in acute decompensated heart failure. Pindolol would be less likely to induce severe bradycardia in comparison to the other β-blockers. Sotalol can prolong the AP duration leading to torsade’s de pointes.

44-year-old man comes to the emergency department for exertional dyspnea, abdominal distention, and abdominal discomfort. He has a history of alcohol abuse, peptic ulcer disease, and acute pancreatitis. Physical examination shows a distended abdomen with shifting dullness and 1+ ankle edema. A diagnostic paracentesis is performed and shows the following: Albumin-2.5 g/dL Neutrophils-200/uL Blood studies show the following: Albumin-3.8 g/dL Glucose-120 mg/dL Aspartate aminotransferase-50 units/L Alanine aminotransferase (ALT)-40 units/L Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's ascites?
questions.correct_answer: B. Increased hepatic capillary hydrostatic pressure
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Increased hepatic capillary hydrostatic pressure

questions.text: A group of investigators examined the effects of different muscarinic agonists and antagonists on the bladder musculature. The curves presented below were constructed after application of different agents. Curve A represents the effect of bethanechol, a pure cholinergic agonist. Which of the curves most likely represents the effect of bethanechol after application of a reversible competitive antagonist?
Which of the following anticancer drugs act at the target shown in figure?

A seventeen-year-old patient is brought to the emergency department having just ingested a large overdose of an antihistaminic drug. This drug is a weak base capable of entering most tissues including the brain. Which of the following statements is true:

options.label: A
options.text: Urinary excretion would be accelerated by administration of NaHCO3, an alkalinizing agent.

options.label: B
options.text: Urinary excretion would be accelerated by the administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent.

options.label: C
options.text: More of the drug would be ionized at blood pH than at stomach pH.

options.label: D
options.text: Absorption of the drug would be faster from the stomach than from the small intestine.

questions.correct_answer: B. Urinary excretion would be accelerated by the administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Urinary excretion would be accelerated by administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent.

questions.text: A 12-year-old child is brought to the emergency department after developing blurred vision and confusion. He was playing in the park and ate an unknown fruit. Temperature is 38.9° C (102° F), blood pressure is 110/76 mm Hg, pulse is 120/min, and respirations are 16/min. He is disoriented to time, place, and person. Physical examination shows flushed skin and dry oral mucosa. Both pupils are dilated and nonreactive to light and accommodation. Bowel sounds are decreased. Which of the following drugs can potentially reverse this patient's condition?

A 1-day old baby is evaluated in the emergency department due to poor feeding, repeated bilious vomiting and not passing meconium since birth. Abdominal examination reveals a distended abdomen. Imaging shows the following picture. Identify the condition which is unlikely in this patient?
Which of the following drugs reversibly binds the site A?

A 65-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to severe lower abdominal pain and nausea. He also has not been able to urinate for the past 24 hours. The patient has a history of hypertension and benign prostatic hyperplasia. On examination, a large mass is palpable in the suprapubic area. Multiple attempts at urethral catheterization are unsuccessful, and an ultrasound-guided midline suprapubic cystostomy is planned. Besides the bladder wall, which of the following structures is most likely to be penetrated by the trocar and cannula during the procedure?

A female presents to OPD with 6 weeks of amenorrhea complaints of bleeding per vagina and mild abdominal pain. The urine pregnancy test is positive and hCG level is 2800 IU/L. On investigation, mass is seen on the left adnexa measuring 3 x 2 cm. She is hemodynamically stable. How will you manage this patient?

A 19-year-old sex worker was treated 2 days ago for presumed gonorrhea with ceftriaxone and azithromycin. She also has a palpable spleen. Laboratory examination is notable for a Hb of 5 g/dL with normal white blood cells and platelets. Peripheral blood smear shows an excess of spherocytes. Which of the following tests will most likely confirm the diagnosis?
Slit lamp ophthalmological examination of a patient revealed the following. All of the following can cause this except:
A 75-year-old male after a fall in bathroom and the pelvic X-ray is shown below. What will be the position of the left lower limb?
Area marked A in the given figure contain all the following, except:

58-year-old, previously healthy man is evaluated due to a 2-month history of early satiety, postprandial epigastric pain and vomiting and unintended weight loss. Physical examination shows cachexia and palpable epigastric mass. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals a large prepyloric mass causing gastric outlet obstruction; biopsy of the mass is consistent with poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma. Abdominal CT scan reveals thickening of the gastric wall with adjacent fat infiltration, enlarged lymph nodes, and multiple hepatic metastatic lesions. The disease is considered unresectable, and the patient undergoes laparoscopic gastrojejunostomy for palliation of gastric outlet obstruction. Postoperatively, he tolerates tube feeding but experiences worsening weakness. The patient also has frequent episodes of non-sustained ventricular tachycardia. Laboratory results are as follows: Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's worsening condition?

A 68-year-old man comes to the OPD for a follow-up appointment. He has a history of advanced melanoma that is unresectable and resistant to adjuvant regimens. The patient recently began receiving monoclonal antibody infusions for advanced melanoma. The monoclonal antibodies block a specific cell surface receptor found on T lymphocytes. As a result, T cells capable of recognizing tumor antigens have improved ability to destroy cancer cells. Which of the following cell surface receptors is most likely blocked by the treatment?

52-year-old man comes to the OPD for evaluation of hearing loss in the left ear. The patient works in sales and is frequently on the phone. Over the past several months, he has had difficulty hearing phone conversations in the left ear and must move the headset to the right. He has no pain or vertigo but sometimes feels off-balance when walking at night and holds onto walls. A tuning fork placed on the forehead is lateralised to the right ear. Air conduction is greater than bone conduction bilaterally. There is decreased sensation to touch on the left side of the face. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

Identify the incorrect statements: Richardson and Koeppe are direct gonioscopes. Narrowing of isopters and the appearance of a blockage within the blind spot are early changes in MS Most common ocular manifestation of COVID-19 is papillary conjunctivitis The Haigis-L regression formula is used for lens power calculation in patients undergoing cataract surgery with a past history of LASIK for myopia. Correct method is to put the eye ointment first, drops 15 min later
The following image depicts an organic poison. Which of the following statements is true about it?

options.label: B
options.text: Weight of one seed is approximately 10g and was used to measure gold in the past.

options.label: C
options.text: Symptoms resemble those of cobra bite.

questions.correct_answer: D. Active principle is a toxalbumin.
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Active principle is a toxalbumin.

questions.text: You are a medical officer posted in the one stop center of your hospital. You are required to collect evidences from a sexual assault victim. What is the correct order of collection according to the instructions given in the SAFE kit?.1- Cervical swab for culture.2- Vaginal swab.3- Clothing.4- Breast swabs.5- Nail clippings.6- Matted pubic hair cutting.7- Pubic hair combing?

A patient has undergone cataract surgery for lens removal and IOL has not been implanted. Instead he is prescribed high power spectacles. Apart from cosmetic blemishes, what other side effects should he not be worried about?
A 46-year-old male presented to the clinic with a persistent cough, fatigue, weight loss, and night sweats. Xray of the patient is as given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old girl is brought to the office after developing fever and a sore throat. The patient recently entered day care, and similar symptoms have been reported in several of the other children. Physical examination shows exudative pharyngitis and enlarged anterior cervical lymph nodes. A rapid antigen detection test confirms the diagnosis of streptococcal throat infection. Her condition resolves with antibiotic therapy. Several weeks later, she is re-exposed to Streptococcus pyogenes. The bacteria penetrating beyond the surface epithelium are immediately coated with preformed IgG antibodies. Which of the following substances acts in the most similar manner to IgG antibodies to facilitate phagocytosis?
Identify the accessory protein marked in the diagram below:

A research laboratory is evaluating a new dipstick test for diagnosing urinary tract infections (UTIs). The new test is compared to urinalysis of a midstream urine specimen (considered the diagnostic gold standard) to establish diagnostic test parameters. The study enrolls 300 patients, of which 100 have a UTI as determined by urinalysis. The new dipstick test is determined to be 70% sensitive and 90% specific for the diagnosis of UTIs. How many false positives are present in the study?

A 52-year-old female patient present with 4 cm diameter diagnosed breast cancer lesion with ipsilateral axillary and contralateral supraclavicular lymphadenopathy as shown below. As per AJCC system, patient belongs to which stage of breast cancer?

Which of the following options is incorrectly matched? Prolapse in pregnancy: Ring Pessary Vault prolapse - Sacrospinous ligament suspension Cystocele - Colposuspension Rectocele - Posterior colporrhaphy Prolapse in a female who desires future child bearing-Shirodkar sling surgery Prolapse in a 65 year old female with DM and hypertension-Le Fort’s colpocleisis

A large, multi-country study is conducted to determine the effect of economic development on cancer incidence and mortality. The study uses data obtained from the national cancer registries, along with information regarding per capita gross domestic product as reported by the International Monetary Fund and life expectancy as reported by the World Health Organization. Which of the following best describes the design of this study?
Match the following images:

Identify the correct scenario: Loss of sensations over the root of penis after lap hernia repair-Ilioinguinal nerve Hyperesthesia of tongue after parotid surgery-Auriculotemporal nerve Diaphragm palsy after thymoma resection-Phrenic nerve Loss of sensations over the lateral gluteal region after hernia mesh repair-LCNT
The anesthetist feels a snap while performing an epidural catheter insertion. This is due to piercing of which structure?

A 32-year-old female presents to the dermatology clinic concerned about white patches on her skin that she noticed since childhood. Physical examination reveals depigmented patches with a symmetrical distribution, especially prominent on the ventral aspect of her body and mid-forehead. White forelock is noted. She mentions that her grandfather had similar patches since his birth. She also reports that a cousin on her father's side has been recently diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. Given the patient's history and clinical presentation, which of the following describes the underlying cause of her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: A polygenic disorder with progressive depigmentation.

options.label: B
options.text: An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene

options.label: C
options.text: An autoimmune condition with progressive depigmentation.

options.label: D
options.text: A sporadic condition without a genetic link.

questions.correct_answer: B. An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene
questions.explanation: Ans. B. An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.

questions.text: In which of the following study designs, the Outcome of interest has already taken place when the study is started?

A surveillance study is conducted to assess the long-term efficacy and safety of a drug currently being used to treat patients with heart failure. Researchers enroll 8,300 patients with heart failure. The patients receive the drug once daily for 6 months. The results show significant clinical improvement, but severe hypernatremia is observed in 23 patients. The study publication recommends a lower dose of the drug in patients with baseline normonatremia and hypokalemia to prevent hypernatremia. Which of the following best characterizes this type of study?
A patient is induced with Thiopentone IV through one of the antecubital veins. The patient complains of severe pain engulfing his whole hand. What is the next line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Give IV propofol through same needle

questions.correct_answer: C. IV lignocaine through same needle

questions.text: A 48-year-old male presented to the clinic with complaints of acute abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. The pain is sudden onset, and severe, in the epigastric and umbilical regions, referred to the back and relieved on bending forwards. He has a past history of chronic alcoholism. On examination, the abdomen is tender with guarding and rigidity, rebound tenderness is present and mild jaundice is evident. Which of the following is the best investigation for this patient?

A 32-year-old female presented to the clinic with complaints of heart racing, diarrhea and intolerance to hot weather. She has a known history of iodine deficiency goiter and is taking iodine supplementations. She has no history of flu-like illness in the past weeks. Her blood results on the recent follow-up are as follows: high T3, high T4 and low TSH. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A group of sports physicians plans to conduct a case-control study to investigate a possible association between adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS) and sacroiliac joint (SIJ) dysfunction in young athletes. The case group will consist of young athletes who were diagnosed with AlS during a regular checkup by a sports physician. Which of the following is the most appropriate control group for this study?

options.label: A
options.text: Young athletes with a diagnosis of AlS and SIJ

options.label: B
options.text: Young athletes with a diagnosis of AlS but not of SIJ

options.label: C
options.text: Young athletes with a diagnosis of AlS irrespective of SIJ status

options.label: D
options.text: Young athletes with no diagnosis of AIS irrespective of SIJ status

questions.correct_answer: D. Young athletes with no diagnosis of AIS irrespective of SIJ status
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Young athletes with no diagnosis of AIS irrespective of SIJ status

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Thelarche is the first sign of puberty in females. Maximum growth occurs in Tanner stages 4 and 5 in males Penile enlargement is the first sign of puberty in males Peak growth velocity always precedes menarche in females

A 34-year-old man presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain and distension. On examination, his vital signs reveal a heart rate of 120 beats per minute and blood pressure of 80/50 mmHg. Abdominal examination reveals diffuse tenderness and distension. The plain abdominal radiograph is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 56-year-old man presented with the sudden onset of a severe headache. He was awake, but feeling uncomfortable because of headache. His initial plain CT head was normal. Lumbar puncture was performed and CSF was shown below. What is the next step?

Identify the true statements about normal fetal development: Endovascular type of extravillious trophoblasts invade the spiral arteries lumen Blood in inferior vena cava has lower oxygen concentration compared to superior Vena cava Functional closure of the fetal circulatory adjustments occurs in the following sequence: Ductus venosus > Foramen ovale > Ductus arteriosus The main factor for the ductal closure postnatally is an increase in partial pressure of oxygen (paO2)

38-year-old woman, gravida para 0, at 34 weeks gestation comes to the OPD due to increasing swelling in her hands and legs. The patient first noticed the swelling a few weeks ago but now cannot stand for more than an hour without needing to elevate her legs. She has no orthopnea, dyspnea, or chest pain. The patient has no chronic medical conditions and takes no daily medications. Vital signs are normal. Cardiac examination is within normal limits. Lungs are clear to auscultation. Bilateral lower extremities have 2+ pitting edema to the midshin. Urine dipstick shows no protein. Compared to a healthy nonpregnant woman, which of the following parameters is most likely to be decreased in this patient?
